summary: This is an email from a U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) staff member to others, forwarding a faxed letter regarding Jeffrey Epstein's case. It notes that a status conference is scheduled and that a 'procurement of minors' charge appears to have been filed.

persons.name: Goldberger
persons.context: The subject line and attachment reference a letter from or to Goldberger, which was faxed and is being forwarded in this email.

persons.name: Black
persons.context: The subject line and attachment reference a letter from or to Black, which was faxed and is being forwarded in this email.

connections.description: Both are named together in the subject and attachment of a legal correspondence regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Email regarding case status
events.description: An email is sent forwarding a faxed letter about the Epstein case, noting a scheduled status conference and the filing of a procurement of minors charge.

events.title: Status conference scheduled
events.description: Police checked the docket and found a status conference scheduled for 8:30 AM.

events.title: Procurement of minors charge filed
events.description: The email states 'it also looks like the required procurement of minors charge has been filed.'

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) regarding the Epstein case.
It references a scheduled 'status conference' for the case.
It indicates that a 'procurement of minors' charge appears to have been filed against Jeffrey Epstein.
The email forwards an attachment titled '080627 Goldberger Black_Ittpdf', suggesting legal correspondence between attorneys Goldberger and Black.
